metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15266 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In GNU Libextractor 1.4, there is a Divide-By-Zero in EXTRACTOR_wav_extract_method in wav_extractor.c via a zero sample rate. It was discovered that Libextractor incorrectly handled zero sample rate. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

extract - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-archive - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-av - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-exiv2 - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-flac - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-gif - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-gstreamer - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-html - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-jpeg - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-midi - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-mpeg - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-ogg - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-ole2 - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-pdf - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-rpm - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-thumbnailgtk - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugin-tiff - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugins-all - 1:1.6-2
libextractor-plugins-misc - 1:1.6-2
libextractor3 - 1:1.6-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libextractor package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.6-2').
